text: Any idea who I could take this up with? I don't have an AM but I have verified these gaps on bots written in 2 different languages running on separate AWS instances. Overlap seems to be just the account and the idiot who wrote the bots - one of which simply dumps received JSON to a file (assuming it can be parsed as JSON). Not really sure what else to try as these gaps are causing me serious problems now - large spots of dead time within races is a bit of a problem.

text: OK I'll run things another day to try and catch some more then I will contact Neil. I just thought that there could be an edge case where if the mid field is missing or corrupt then I would see exactly the issues that I am seeing. I dump to file based on a filename generated from the mid field so I've tweaked my stream collecter to also dump everything to a master file. Should be able to spot if that is the issue after the first at Penn tonight - if not I will email Neil.

text: Gaps observed on BOTH instances but not over same time intervals. Its almost as if the RRC dropouts are on a per client IP address basis. I am at a complete loss to explain that as being a problem at my end.

text:
On the stream API, when making requests you supply an "id" field to match responses to a subscription request. Docs say specifically that

`id - A unique counter you should supply on a RequestMessage and which will be supplied back on a ResponseMessage.`

I've always assumed that the "uniqueness" here is with respect to each connection, rather than accross ALL connections you may use. Essentially I am asking if it is possible that I am causing problems running say 2 streams connections but using the same ID on the market subscription requests? Clutching at straws a bit here but just wondering if people use globally unique "id" fields across their entire production setup or if uniqueness inside each connection is sufficient.

elements.text: On the stream API, when making requests you supply an "id" field to match responses to a subscription request. Docs say specifically that

I've always assumed that the "uniqueness" here is with respect to each connection, rather than accross ALL connections you may use. Essentially I am asking if it is possible that I am causing problems running say 2 streams connections but using the same ID on the market subscription requests? Clutching at straws a bit here but just wondering if people use globally unique "id" fields across their entire production setup or if uniqueness inside each connection is sufficient.
